This is easily one of my favorite PC games. I like it more than its sequel, because it's kinda scary. There's a variety of enemies, levels and classes (weapons). You should be quite entertained, even if the graphics are a little dated.

Now, I never played killing floor 2 before and I choose to buy this because apparently it had more players than its sequel (and because it was cheaper). I’m extremely happy with what I got, and what I got was a game with perhaps not the best graphics in the world but a very enjoyable co-op system. 
I haven’t played single player so I don’t know this, but co-op is probably the way the game is supposed to be played, and if for any reason at all you are not going to play co-op, you shouldn’t really get this game as there are better single player zombie slaughter games out there. Like I mentioned the graphics are not very good but definitely acceptable considering the games age and the developer’s budget at the time.
Although this game has a lot of DLCs which I know for a fact put off some people from getting the game, the DLCs don’t really affect the game that much and are only some skins for your characters and guns you can do without. The players of the game are definitely very friendly from my experience. The game is relatively easy to play and generally not very challenging until the later waves of zombies or “zeds” as the game calls it.
Overall I would recommend the game if you have friends that are willing to play with you and have some fun, or even just to connect to a random server and make some friends;  but if you don’t have any one to play with then if could get quite boring.


UPDATE: After playing Killing Floor 2, i can now say that personally KF2 is not as good as this game, gameplay wise.
Amazing and addictive and tons of replay value. Listen to Tool as you play if you want a better experience.

Killing Floor is a wave-based FPS focusing on the extermination of Horzine's test subjects referred to as Zeds, and their leader Kevin Clamely, better known as the Patriarch.

[h1]The good[/h1]
There are many different maps (both custom and vanilla), weapons, perks, characters, Zeds and themes (Halloween, Christmas, hillbilly and circus maps and Zeds). There’s usually multiple ways in which you can succeed in these, such as camping in one place or being on the move constantly.

Killing stuff is a very satisfying time-waster. Shoot, burn, slash, disintegrate, explode, gib, intoxicate, dismember and decapitate the enemy as you please.

The difficulty and learning curve in this game are quite good. While the game is rather unfriendly towards newer players (in mechanics and the fact perk weapons cost more when your level is lower), it is easier to master even the highest difficulty. That is not to say this game won’t offer you a challenge.
There also exist servers with a boosted difficulty level, should the base max difficulty level become too easy.

This is a game in which having a somewhat high ping does not directly make it unplayable. Even at 150 ping, you can still contribute to a game (granted that your skill allows it). This means you can essentially play worldwide reasonably okay, with a few limits.

There are many options with the console, like making custom text, voiceline binds, useful gameplay commands, commands that make certain tasks easier, commands for fun stuff, etc.

This game has good replay value. I've crossed a thousand hours and still haven't had enough of this game. Some have 3000, 4000 or even more hours logged and still play to this day.
 
This game is not a very not-demanding one. Some pretty old and/or crappy rigs can run this game just fine. A friend of mine who has a 10 year old laptop can still run it, and another one used to run it on their Vista.

[h1]The bad[/h1]
The playerbase is definitely the worst part of this game, especially now that we’re a few years down the line and staring at what’s left of it. It's a lot of bad and inexperienced or perk-farmed players joining high difficulty games and causing it to fail or make it more burdensome, but there are also quite a number of trolls in the circuit. It’s come to my attention that there’s essentially two groups: new and regular players who just play normally, and the considerably more experienced players who have gotten bored of the game and as result find different ways to entertain themselves in Killing Floor. Sadly, their idea of entertainment is to ruin the fun for somebody else. Not every server allows kickvoting and where it does, you need several kickvotes for it to process, but not every player is aware a kickvote is going on, so this is often a quite arduous process.

Another fact about the playerbase is that not too many people play this game anymore (though it's definitely not dead). At the right hours you'll usually find enough servers to play on with others but the choices are limited.

A lot of the characters and weapons are put in paid DLC packs. Some of these weapons are a serious boon, such as the flare gun. On sale, they are pretty affordable, though, and most of the better weapons are in a single DLC pack or can be unlocked by achievements.

The game is somewhat buggy and outdated on several fronts. It is more than 10 years old at the time of writing, after all.

[h1]The verdict[/h1]

A great game with a not-so-great playerbase. If you manage to stay out of the way of аssholes, grievers and psychos and just play with friendly players or your friends, you'll keep coming back at it many times.

Bought this game on sale for $4.99 and what a challenging, hard, great zombie wave shooter! I love the co-op and online games are still available even though this is an old game. There are 5 modes: Beginner, Normal, Hard, Suicidal, and Hell on Earth. I bet you that it will take a looooonnnggg time before you can get to the last mode let alone to Normal mode! Great non toxic community even though you will get the keyboard warrior once in a while but it is rare! If you loved Left For Dead 2 and want a real challenge then get this! 10/10 Get it even at 20 bones.

A Pioneer in it's field, Killing Floor brought the wave by wave combat of an RTS or Castle Defense game to a horrific and somewhat realistic first person zombie setting. A game like this needs little explaining, but basically it's left 4 dead but slower and more gruesome(and also came out before it, as many people fail to realize). 10/10 classic zombie multiplayer fun.

A multiplayer First Person Shooter with an addictive gameplay loop, the game is designed from ground up to be a cooperative experience for teams of players. Antagonists are zombies that approach players in waves, and in-between rounds, survivors earn cash that can be put towards upgraded weapons, armor, or other perks. The zombies  themselves get progressively more difficult, and the game has a variety of different types, such as zombies that scream at you to cause splash damage, zombies with arms modified into buzz-saws, and zombies with rocket launchers...just to name a few. Each must be approached a little differently, which enhances the cooperative element of the game and adds variety to gameplay. On the final wave, a special "boss" zombie spawns that is extra tough and capable of nasty tricks that can take players by surprise if they don't work well as a team.

It's basically a deeper version of Left4Dead, if Left4Dead had a Moba-style upgrade path and a greater variety of zombies to fight.

I think Killing Floor is one of those games people either love it or hate it. Since its official release in 2009 (previously being just an Unreal Tournament mod) this is a game that has gained a very loyal community over  the years and at one point it was one of the top games on Steam. I think is important to mention Killing Floor is kind of a resurrected game; prior to the 2017 humble bundle giveaway this game pretty much had a foot in the grave with a mere 300 to 400 players at peak hours. Now, as of July there are up to 5000 players and that is something that actually, really makes me happy. My experience with Killing Floor has been mostly positive despite being a somewhat repetitive game, it has an undeniably charm. Gameplay has its own learning curve so this is not the type of game where you can do whatever the hell you want and expect to win. Teamwork is important just like learning the entire game mechanisms. It takes time but if you are really enjoying the game, once you know how everything works you will have no trouble in giving Killing Floor hundreds of hours.

*БРИТАНСКИЙ ОБИТЕЛЬ ЗЛА*

  Скажу сразу, что с этой игрой я знаком с 2012 года, благодаря моему хорошему школьному другу, с которым  мы часто ходили в Интернет-клубы, пропадая там на несколько часов. Именно там я познакомился с многими играми жанрами Кооперативной игры. Одной из них была она, одна из горячо моих любимых до сих пор - Killing Floor. 
  В целом сюжет разворачивается вокруг корпорации "Горизонт" и военным вирусом и опыты ... (В общем замените "Горизонт" на "Umbrella" и само все прекрасно поймете.) 
 
  Поиграв в пиратскую версию игры около тысячи часов. Я приобрел эту игру, как ностальгию и дань уважения прошедшим боям. Ну и затем, чтобы с пацанами по LAN посидеть...
  Теперь почему я считаю, что вам следует попробовать в нее поиграть:

1) В игре представлены 7 разных классов: Медик, Коммандос, Подрывник, Поджигатель, Снайпер, Берсерк и Техник. У каждого имеются свои особенности и свой предпочтительный арсенал. 
2) Разновидонсти мяса здесь тоже есть. От простых зомби, который убиваются с одного-двух выстрелов в голову, до огромных светящихся юнитов, которые могу вас размозжить с первого раза. И каждому нужно искать свою тактику.  
3) Игровая механика пострена на том, чтобы продержаться определенное количество волн. В промежутках между волнами открывается магазин, где можно закупится. И на последней волне вас встречает босс, создатель - Патриарх.
4) Killing Floor, как CS 1.6, как Half-Life, как карта Dota в Warcraft III - никогда не умрут. Поэтому купив эту игру у вас не будет проблем с поиском сервера для игры. Игроки постоянно обновляют игру, создавая новые моды, оружие и карты.

В целом мой вердик -  Эта игра достойна быть в вашей библиотеке. Отличная игра для игры одному или в кампании друзей
